intro: Obsidian+ Web Clipper is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how your data is handled when using the extension.

items.label: Identity
items.text: If you connect a cloud provider (e.g., Google Drive), we request your email for authentication purposes only.

items.label: Clipped Content
items.text: All content you clip is stored locally on your device or in your connected cloud storage. We do not store any content on our servers.

items.label: Settings
items.text: Your vault path, user preferences, and configurations are stored locally using Chrome's storage APIs.
We do not collect, track, or sell your personal data.
We do not use analytics or third-party trackers.
We do not store or transmit any clipped content to external servers.

items.label: nativeMessaging
items.text: Allows communication with the native host app to save data to your Obsidian vault.

items.label: activeTab, scripting, tabs
items.text: Enables capturing content from your current browser tab.

items.label: contextMenus
items.text: Adds right-click clip options on pages.

items.label: storage
items.text: Saves user preferences like vault paths, templates, etc.

items.label: identity, identity.email
items.text: Used for optional authentication when integrating cloud sync.

sections.title: 4. Cloud Access (Optional)
sections.description: When you choose to link a cloud provider, Obsidian+ uses secure OAuth to connect. All access is limited to your own files and can be revoked at any time from your provider's dashboard.

sections.title: 5. Contact
sections.description: If you have any questions or concerns regarding this privacy policy, please contact us at azeemkhandsari@gmail.com.
